course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Chinese Oil Painting
course.description: This course gives students knowledge of the development of oil painting in China. Focus will be given to the periods between 1979 and 1989 and from 1989 to the present. By looking at Chinese oil painting of different periods, the course explores the social, cultural and political circumstances which favored, oppressed or directed the path of the development of this medium.

reviews.author: greenpancake
reviews.comment_content:
Covers the history of Chinese oil painting from the 16th century to the current day.
The content itself is ok. The slides are clear to read and honestly much more helpful than the lectures. But a lot of names and terms are directly translated from Chinese, so it would be hard for non-Chinese speakers to memorize the content.
reviews.comment_teaching:
It is obvious that she put considerable effort to prep for her lectures, but she uses repetitive vocab and never explains the content in-depth.

She does rely too much on the powerpoint. The lecture is so boring that it is mentally impossible to stay focused even though you try to be a good student.

But you can't skip class because attendance is required. Instead of improving her teaching skills, she prefers punishment than positive reinforcement: she doesn't seem to understand that you don't care about oil painting that much and she can take extreme measures for attendance.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assessment of student performance
1. Short Quiz 1 (30%)
‐ MC questions, Fill‐in‐the‐blanks, True/False questions, short questions
2. Short Quiz 2 (30%)
‐ MC questions, Fill‐in‐the‐blanks, True/False questions, short questions
3. Final Exam (30%)
‐ MC questions, Fill‐in‐the‐blanks, True/False questions, short questions, essay
4. Attendance (10%)
‐ will be checked 10 times randomly after the add/drop period, 1% will be deducted for
each absence

Each exams only have 30 questions, which means each 1 question accounts for 1% of your final grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
You cannot expect what will be tested on the exam. All questions are random. Meaningless. Trivial details. She just expects you to memorize the whole thing and tests you on the most unnoticeable triviality that has absolutely nothing to do with art appreciation.
100% guarantee that you will learn absolutely nothing in this class (if you don't see hard-core memorization as a skill). This is THE class that I feel the strongest that my tuition is going to waste.

reviews.author: lwllllll
reviews.comment_content:
Artwork, art History, and oil painting development from Ming Dynasties to1989
Political Pop, Cynical Realism, Abstract Art, Neo‐Expressionism

10 random attendance (10%)
short quiz 1  (30%)
MC questions, Fill‐in‐the‐blanks, True/False questions, short questions
short quiz 2  (30%)
MC questions, Fill‐in‐the‐blanks, True/False questions, short questions
final  (30%)

reviews.comment_workload: Need to memorize names of painters in pinyin and names or year of paintings in pinyin. Every powerpoints have a lot of slides. Also, the course has a lot of reading materials.

reviews.author: Alexdunn
reviews.title: Lot of memorization
reviews.comment_content: Lot of chinese names, fine if you speak chinese but very challenging to memorize for international or non chinese speaking students. covers a lot more than just oil painting, references art markets, artist communities, art institutes etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: dry lectures, read from the slides with very few personal  anecdotes.
reviews.comment_grading:
based on random attendance checks, 2 midterms, and final.

midterms: true/false, multiple choice, fill in the blank.
final: multiple choice, fill in the blank, short answer, and an essay.
reviews.comment_workload: lot of memorizing names, dates, and paintings from powerpoints. not much analysis or in depth thought just straight up memorizing the slide decks. each test was not cumulative but covered approximately 300-400 slides of content. every slide has paintings or artists names etc.

reviews.author: normalx
reviews.title: Fair course
reviews.comment_content: The content is all about the historical development of Chinese oil painting.If you want to learn painting skills,dont choose this course.If you are interested in history,you would have a lot fun.
reviews.comment_grading:
30% midterm X2
30% final
10% attendence

Memorize all the lecture notes and you can get good grade.The questions are very straightforward.

Attendence was ticked randomly.Do attend all lesson if you want full mark in attendence
reviews.comment_workload: Only 2 midteam and 1 final exam.No assignment and presentation.In my opinion,you can ignore the reading as the content of exam can all be found in lecture notes.

reviews.author: Carolina
reviews.title: All about memorizing
reviews.comment_content: If you are interested in art history, you will find the content engaging, otherwise that's very unlikely.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Kwong is sweet and very available to help students during office hours
reviews.comment_grading:
20-25% of students get A-range, so it's not too bad
The quizzes are non-cumulative, but that doesn't help much. There are 30 questions in each quiz, each on counts for 1% or your final grade.
reviews.comment_workload: There isn't really any homework, but you will have to memorize every single word on each 60 pages powerpoint that she covers in every class
